(DBi) Program   Semester Abroad   Summer Programs   Faculty-Led Courses   Other Opportunities     Contact Us             Home / Portal & Partners / Office of Student Engagement / International Programs / Semester Abroad / Students                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Students                            Current Students                      Non-NYU Students                      Prospective Students                            The application period for study abroad takes place each spring for the following academic year.    All students who have satisfied their Stern core requirements (except for Professional Responsibility and the Langone Core), and are in good academic standing are eligible to participate in semester exchange programs abroad.    Current students can also visit our page on CampusGroups for more information.              Students wishing to spend a semester abroad at NYU Stern should contact their home schools and universities for more information.              NYU offers unique opportunities to integrate a global learning component into each student's program of study. Study Abroad is open to full-time and Langone MBA students. For more information, visit NYU Stern's Admissions site . (DBi) Program   Semester Abroad   Summer Programs   Faculty-Led Courses   Other Opportunities     Contact Us             Home / Portal & Partners / Office of Student Engagement / International Programs / Faculty-Led Courses                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Faculty-Led International Courses  Unparalleled global courses that you can only find at NYU Stern  The MBA International Programs team at NYU Stern encourages students to view the world as their classroom. Faculty-led courses offer unique academic opportunities that leverage NYU Stern and university faculty to provide unparalleled international courses. Participating students are provided with varying levels of administrative support from the Office of Student Engagement to facilitate these exciting opportunities. A sampling of past courses have included:     Operations in Panama- For more information about Professor Harry Chernoff, please see his NYU Stern Faculty Bio.    Social Problem-Based Entrepreneurship - For more information on Professor Hans Taparia, please see his NYU Stern Faculty Bio .    Cuba: Sanctions, Reform, Opportunities - For more information about Professor Robert Roach, please see his NYU Stern Faculty Bio.    For more information on any of our faculty-led courses, please contact us . Current students can also visit our CampusGroups page for a list of current courses being offered and detailed instuctions on registration. (DBi) Program   Semester Abroad   Summer Programs   Faculty-Led Courses   Other Opportunities     Contact Us             Home / Portal & Partners / Office of Student Engagement / International Programs                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                                                Learn from the World   Stern has long recognized the importance of a global mindset in a student's education. MBA International Programs provide opportunties for Stern students to study abroad for a semester, a summer, or an intensive one to two week class. We offer these intercultural experiences around the world, allowing students to learn on an international scale and gain concrete skills that will allow them to be successful in an increasingly global business landscape.    For more information, please contact us or visit our program-specific pages to the left. Current students can also visit our CampusGroups portal for more detailed information on academic policies, registration, and course syllabi.
